intro: Tephrosia sinapou, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or greenish-yellow. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine and has potential agricultural applications due to its nitrogen-fixing properties.
